words.definition: Anymore means any longer.
words.example: Her old pants don't fit her anymore.

words.definition: When a person is asleep, they are not awake.
words.example: The baby has been asleep for three hours.

words.definition: A berry is a small, soft fruit that grows on a bush.
words.example: The ran is berry good.

words.definition: To collect is to group things together.
words.example: I collected shells when I was at the beach.

words.definition: To compete is to try to be better than someone else.
words.example: He will compete with a lot of people in the race.

words.definition: A conversation is a talk between people.
words.example: There were two people having a conversation.

words.definition: A creature is any living thing.
words.example: The creature from the movie was very scary.

words.definition: A decision is a choice.
words.example: He made the right decision to go to school.

words.definition: Either is used with or to show a choice.
words.example: You can have either ice cream or cake.

words.definition: A forest is a place with many trees.
words.example: The forest was very quiet.

words.definition: The ground is the top part of the earth.
words.example: The ground was covered with snow.

words.definition: To introduce is to say who someone is.
words.example: I introduced my friends to my parents.

words.definition: To marry is to become husband and wife.
words.example: Rose and Jack got married.

words.definition: To prepare is to get ready for something.
words.example: I prepared my food before I went to work.

words.definition: To sail is to travel on water in a boat.
words.example: I like to sail my boat on the lake.

words.definition: If something is serious, it is bad or dangerous.
words.example: The car accident was very serious.

words.definition: To spend is to use money or time.
words.example: I spent a lot of money on my car.

words.definition: If something is strange, it is not normal.
words.example: There was a strange smell in the kitchen.

words.definition: The truth is a fact or something that is right.
words.example: He always tells the truth.

words.definition: To wake is to stop sleeping.
words.example: I woke up early this morning.
